definition[0]: something that is intended to make people like your plans or activities, and to stop them seeing the true situation – used to show disapproval
example[0]: All these glossy pamphlets are just window dressing – the fact is that the new mall will ruin the neighborhood.
definition[1]: the art of arranging goods in a shop window so that they look attractive to customers
definition[2]: when people try to give the public a favourable idea about something, sometimes hiding the true situation
example[1]: Stock prices benefited from window dressing by some money managers anxious to present good reports to clients.
